title: Social Engineering and Security Awareness
description: Test your knowledge of social engineering techniques, attacks, and security awareness best practices. This quiz covers phishing, pretexting, baiting, and methods for defending against social engineering attacks.

answers.text: The process of designing social media platforms
The process of manipulating people into performing actions or divulging confidential information
The process of developing social skills
The process of building social networks
A type of social engineering attack that uses email, SMS, or other communication channels to trick users into revealing sensitive information or installing malware
A type of fishing that uses electronic equipment
A type of network security protocol
A type of encryption algorithm
A type of phishing that targets a specific individual or organization
A type of phishing that targets multiple individuals or organizations
A type of phishing that uses spears as weapons
A type of phishing that targets only government organizations
A type of social engineering attack that involves creating a fabricated scenario to obtain information or access
A type of encryption algorithm
A type of network security protocol
A type of authentication mechanism
A type of social engineering attack that involves offering something enticing to the victim, such as a free download or USB drive, that contains malware
A type of encryption algorithm
A type of network security protocol
A type of authentication mechanism

questions.text: What is tailgating in the context of physical security?

answers.text: Following too closely behind another vehicle
A social engineering technique where an unauthorized person follows an authorized person into a secured area
A type of network security protocol
A type of authentication mechanism

questions.text: What is the purpose of security awareness training?

answers.text: To teach employees how to develop security software
To teach employees how to hack into systems
To educate employees about security threats and best practices to protect against them
To teach employees how to encrypt data

questions.text: What is a security awareness program?

answers.text: A program for developing security software
A comprehensive approach to educating employees about security threats and best practices
A program for hacking into systems
A program for encrypting data

questions.text: What is the best defense against social engineering attacks?

answers.text: Installing antivirus software
Using strong passwords
Education and awareness
Encrypting all data

questions.text: What should you do if you suspect you've received a phishing email?

answers.text: Reply to the sender asking for more information
Click on any links to verify if they are legitimate
Forward the email to your friends to warn them
Do not click on any links or attachments, and report the email to your IT department or security team
